intro: Parodia alacriportana, commonly known as the "Lunar Cactus," is a species of cactus native to the arid regions of South America. It is characterized by its compact, globular shape and a dense covering of white or pale blue spines. The plant produces yellow flowers during the warmer months, which bloom in the evening, adding to its unique appearance. It is well adapted to extreme desert conditions, with thick, fleshy stems that store water efficiently. Due to its striking appearance and low maintenance requirements, it is a popular choice for succulent enthusiasts.
